Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2017 11:22PM Sydsym wrote: I’ve been lurking on the site since I was diagnosed back in March and I just want to say how grateful I am for all the wonderful information and support given here. I started my rads (just right breast) on the 30th and at 11/28 down so far so good. I’m starting to see some darkening but so far no redness, soreness or blistering. I’m big on mixing different moisturizers together so I have been slathering eucerin with palmers cocoa butter and/or shea butter on the area after treatment. I figure if I see it’s not working I’ll switch to something else and the nurse at the radiologist’s office hasn’t told me I’m doing anything wrong yet. I’m doing the deep inspiration breath hold as part of my treatment and was wondering if anyone else is also and what their experience had been with it? I haven’t seen much info on the boards about it. I was nervous at first about whether I could sustain holding my breath for the 20 or so seconds but I think because I’ve been doing yoga for years it hasn’t been as hard as I expected.
